intro: Solanecio lainzii, commonly known as the Lainz's solanecio, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas. It produces small, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Solanecio lainzii is considered a rare and endemic species.
